title: Echoes from Alexandria: A Large Resource for Multilingual Book Summarization. (arXiv:2306.04334v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: In recent years, research in text summarization has mainly focused on the news domain, where texts are typically short and have strong layout features. The task of full-book summarization presents additional challenges which are hard to tackle with current resources, due to their limited size and availability in English only. To overcome these limitations, we present "Echoes from Alexandria", or in shortened form, "Echoes", a large resource for multilingual book summarization. Echoes features three novel datasets: i) Echo-Wiki, for multilingual book summarization, ii) Echo-XSum, for extremely-compressive multilingual book summarization, and iii) Echo-FairySum, for extractive book summarization. To the best of our knowledge, Echoes, with its thousands of books and summaries, is the largest resource, and the first to be multilingual, featuring 5 languages and 25 language pairs. translated_title: 亚历山大的回声：一个用于多语全书摘要的大型资源
translated_abstract: 最近，文本摘要的研究主要集中在新闻领域，其中文本通常很短并具有强烈的布局特征。全书摘要的任务提出了额外的挑战，这些挑战很难通过当前的资源来处理，因为它们的规模有限且仅在英语中提供。为了克服这些限制，我们提出了"Echoes from Alexandria"（或简称为"Echoes"），这是一个用于多语全书摘要的大型资源。Echoes包括三个新颖的数据集：i) Echo-Wiki，用于多语全书摘要；ii）Echo-XSum，用于极度压缩的多语全书摘要；iii）Echo-FairySum，用于抽取式全书摘要。据我们所知，Echoes是最大的资源，也是第一个多语言资源，包括5种语言和25种语言对。除了Echoes，我们还介绍了一个新的抽取-概括基线，并根据我们使用Echoes的经验，确定了全书摘要研究的有前途的未来方向。
tldr: 本文介绍了一个名为"Echoes from Alexandria"的大型资源，它包括三个新颖的数据集，可用于多语全书摘要，是第一个多语言资源，也是最大的资源。同时，作者提出了一个新的抽取-概括基线，并确定了全书摘要研究的有前途的未来方向。
